title: PESU Placements CSE 2025 Batch Updated Sheet
content:
[https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1SnSNM\_GnuTwIJ0oI3bHt9nAnDQXfqwIhT8JHEwq727g](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1SnSNM_GnuTwIJ0oI3bHt9nAnDQXfqwIhT8JHEwq727g)

there are many placement sheets available for the 2025 batch but this is the only one I found which is updated till May 2025 - hope it helps

comments.body: IBM intake is crazy
Can someone calculate the average and mean?
If you remove IBM , tier 1 offers are gonna be less than 100 ?¬†
whats the difference between FTE only, FTE+Intern, Intern(PBC)?
I think about 350 t1 offers excluding ibm
Any idea what was the strength of cse batch of '25
no way the t1 offers in the sheet excluding IBM touch 200

I was told many times that if you fall in TIER 1 category (Provided 8.75 cg+), you are more likely to have above 13lpa  
But I have noticed many TIER1 below 12lpa even. Has the skills of the grads reduced or are the companies not offering much?
Same question
FTE is when you start working only after your 8th sem, FTE+Intern is when they select you for the 8th sem internship too and that will be converted into a FTE by PPO
Check properly
you are right üôèüôèüôè
And spring internship means no fte and only internship ?
a PPO is still possible, spring internship is the 8th sem compulsory internship
Its 12lpa base
PBC? I am not sure what u meant to say. Its just spring internship in 8th sem that is mandatory
Is PESU is good for MCA? And what's about placement?
Average and mean both refer to the same thing chote bhai
Around 850
Yeah got it...
please search FAQs or other posts. I am sure u will find your answer

Have a another doubt... how are CS students getting placed into core ECE companies - samsung semiconductors,renesas,Bigendian semiconductors and also is there a placement sheet for 2025 ECE students as well?...
3 FAANG Companies visiting PES (Apple,Amazon,Microsoft) is huge...
Flipkart also
but no one got placed in flipkart according to the sheet

yep, check this. This is for 2025 batch. U wont find any old ones  -

[https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1GN0hXmrWHRGo75Y9vAlBFVkdVYi0lXYoLAncGVhW7CY/edit?usp=sharing](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1GN0hXmrWHRGo75Y9vAlBFVkdVYi0lXYoLAncGVhW7CY/edit?usp=sharing)
median\* üôè
Many end up at Google through off-campus also btw. I know its not on-campus, but still adds to value at the end of the day.
12 lpa is ctc for tier 1, not base. 12+ ctc is t1 , 6-12 ctc is t2 and below 6 is t3. its about how much a company is offering nothing to do with skill reduction or anything.
median is 12.5 , there was an nirf doc in this sub , u can search it.

if a company(be it "core ECE" company as you say) allows the students from a branch , then the students are allowed to sit for that company.  
some IT companies also allow all branches for , which means other branches like mech/ece/ee can sit for these companies as well.
Have you got your answer?
Not yet, analyzing NIRF data and planning to go to the PES University and try interact with student.
can i dm u ?
Crazy numbers for a t2 college. Do some people get multiple t1 offers or are these all distinct people?
Crazy numbers for a tier 2 college. Do some people get multiple t1 offers or are these all distinct people?
